meanings.definition: The quality of being coy or shy.
meanings.sent1: Her coynesses made it difficult for others to approach her.
meanings.sent2: I could see the coynesses in her eyes as she blushed and looked away.
meanings.sent3: Despite her coynesses, she couldn't hide her excitement when she won the award.
meanings.sent4: The coynesses of the cat as it played with the string was endearing.
meanings.sent5: The coynesses of the flower petals as they slowly opened in the morning sunlight was captivating.

meanings.definition: The act of feigning shyness or reserve.
meanings.sent1: His coynesses was just an act to hide his true intentions.
meanings.sent2: She used coynesses to make others underestimate her abilities.
meanings.sent3: The coynesses of the magician was all part of his grand illusion.
meanings.sent4: The coynesses of the fox as it lured the rabbit closer was cunning.
meanings.sent5: The coynesses of the clouds as they covered the moon created a mysterious atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A reluctance to give information or show one's true feelings.
meanings.sent1: Her coynesses in revealing her past hinted at hidden secrets.
meanings.sent2: The suspect's coynesses during questioning raised suspicions.
meanings.sent3: The coynesses of the old book about its author's identity intrigued readers.
meanings.sent4: The coynesses of the ocean depths kept its mysteries hidden from explorers.
meanings.sent5: The coynesses of the locked chest left everyone curious about its contents.
